item.title: Discover gerrymandering in Georgia's 2021 congressional districting plan
item.description: Researchers at Georgia Tech used NRPT to statistically identify gerrymandering in Georgia’s 2021 congressional districting plan.

item.title: Generating first image of Sagittarius A*
item.description: The Event Horizon Telescope (EHT) used non-reversible parallel tempering to generate the photograph of Sagittarius A*, the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way.

item.title: Modeling evolution of single-cell cancer genomes
item.description: The BC Cancer Research Center (BCCRC) and Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSK) used ‘Blang,’ a new probabilistic programming language using NRPT, to model the evolution of single-cell cancer genomes. See the links for the resulting Nature paper and the Journal of Statistical Software paper on Blang.

item.title: Modelling plasma dynamics in nuclear fusion reactor
item.description: TAE Technologies, Inc. (TAE) and Google research used NRPT in conjuction with Hamiltonian Monte Carlo to tackle ill-conditioned Bayesian inverse problems that arise when modelling the plasma dynamics in the world largest field-reversed configuration (FCR) nuclear fusion reactor.

item.title: Discovering magnetic polarization in M87 supermassive black hole
item.description: NRPT was an essential tool required by the Event Horizon Telescope ( EHT ) to discover magnetic polarization in the supermassive black hole at the center of galaxy M87, represented by the swirls. See Chapter 4 of Paul Tiede ’s Ph.D. Thesis (Chapter 4) for a detailed comparison of NRPT against previous state-of-the-art samplers.
